title: Dashboard resident list: explicit load-failure UI with retry (React Query error states)

requirements.summary: Show explicit resident list load errors (vs empty state) on Dashboard for all/active/discharged queries, with a user-invokable retry that refetches the relevant query.
acceptanceCriteria: If any resident list query (all/active/discharged) fails, the Dashboard displays an explicit error message in English (instead of showing “No residents found”).
The error UI includes a user-invokable retry control that triggers refetching/invalidation of the relevant resident queries.
When the backend returns an actual empty list successfully, the existing “No residents found” empty state continues to display.

file_operations.description: Adjust resident list React Query hooks (useGetAllResidents/useGetActiveResidents/useGetDischargedResidents) so failures surface as query errors (rather than being masked as successful empty arrays), enabling the Dashboard to reliably distinguish load failure vs true-empty results.

Update the Dashboard resident list rendering for the All/Active/Discharged tabs to handle React Query error states (isError/error) distinctly from empty successful results, and add a clear Retry control that triggers refetching/invalidation for the specific failed resident query.
